intro: Centaurea angusticeps, commonly known as narrowleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its slender leaves and vivid blue or purple flowers make it a distinctive species within its native range. Centaurea angusticeps is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated in some areas for garden use.
